app.viewmanagers

Class TaskListViewManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.viewmanagers.TaskListViewManager

  • public class TaskListViewManager
extends java.lang.Object
    TaskListViewManager manages the ListView object, which is responsible for creating and displaying individual ListCell objects that represent a TodoItem each.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        In our implementation, we are using a custom CellFactory for generating ListCells. This opens up the class to allow customized controls and methods. The placeholder of the ListView also differs based on the user's context. This can be either a ListView with 0 tasks (welcomePane) or a search view with 0 results (emptySearch Label).

      • setEmptySearchPlaceholder

        public void setEmptySearchPlaceholder()
        Set the placeholder when there are no results for a search term.

      • setUserGuidePlaceholder

        public void setUserGuidePlaceholder()
        Set the placeholder when the task list is empty.

      • updateView

        public void updateView(javafx.collections.ObservableList<TodoItem> taskData)
        This method is called from various components whenever the task list needs to be updated. For example, searching and changing view context (Overdue, Done, Undone) uses this method.
        Parameters:
        taskData -

      • convertUUIDtoIndex

        private int convertUUIDtoIndex(java.util.UUID uuid,
                               javafx.collections.ObservableList<TodoItem> taskData)
        To pinpoint to a specific task in the current visible task list, the implementation does not provide an accurate task index, as these tasks are filtered out by their statuses (done, undone) into different lists. Hence, we're making use of a more unique identifier, the UUID. This method does a linear search in the current task list to get the index of the task with the specific UUID. Returns -1 if task is not found.
        Parameters:
        uuid -
        taskData -
        Returns:
        index of task in current task list with the specified UUID.

      • getCurrentColor

        public java.lang.String getCurrentColor()
        When the user disable random colors, this method returns the selected color that was initialized at launch time.
        Returns:
        the chosen color.

      • getRandomColor

        public java.lang.String getRandomColor()
        When the user enables random colors, this method generates the colors to be applied for each ListCell.
        Returns:
        a random color.
